title: 425 women jailed during this year: PM
byline: Some 425 women have been convicted and sent to jail from January 1 to August 31 this year, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: Opposition MPs urge for action on privilege issues without delay
byline: Opposition Members of Parliament including Rohana Bandara and Jagath Withana today called for action on the privilege issues raised by them in Parliament several days ago.

title: Major US airports see delays as government shutdown hits air travel
byline: US air travellers are experiencing a second day of flight delays and cancellations, as the government shutdown causes a worsening shortage of air traffic controllers.

title: RTI appeal filed over refusal to disclose President’s domestic travel costs
byline: A YouTuber who has consistently sought information relating to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s domestic travel costs, has submitted an appeal to the Right to Information (RTI) Commission, challenging the decision of the Presidential Secretariat’s Designated Officer to reject his information.

title: Ten women conceive as sperm bank brings hope
byline: The newly established sperm bank at Castle Street Hospital for Women in Colombo has produced encouraging results with ten women successfully conceiving through the facility’s services, hospital officials said.

title: Police warn public against rising online financial frauds
byline: The Sri Lanka Police have issued an urgent warning to the public about the growing number of financial frauds being committed through social media platforms, particularly on Telegram, WhatsApp, and other online groups.

title: Gazette issues to curb spread of African Swine Fever
byline: An extraordinary gazette notification has been issued to prevent the further spread of African swine fever (ASF), which has affected several Divisional Secretariats across the country in recent months.

title: Threat of power cuts looms?
byline: The country is at risk of facing power cuts and potential instability following the Electricity Engineers’ Union’s decision to suspend all work regulations from 4:15 p.m. yesterday, intensifying its ongoing trade union action, Samagi Joint Trade Union Alliance Convener Ananda Palitha warned.

title: New number plates to include seven safety features: Bimal
byline: The new vehicle number plates will include seven safety features and six features have already been accredited by the Moratuwa University, Transport Minister Bimal Ratnayake said today.

title: Parliament to debate transferring of Police Commission powers to IGP
byline: Tomorrow Parliament is to debate the move to transfer Police Commission powers to the Inspector General  of Police (IGP).

title: US special envoy and Trump’s son-in-law to join Gaza peace talks in Egypt
byline: US special envoy Steve Witkoff and US President Donald Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner will join Gaza peace plan talks between Israeli and Hamas negotiators in Egypt on Wednesday.

title: Renowned singer and radio Actress Chandrani Gunawardana passes away
byline: Renowned Sri Lankan singer, radio voice actress, and stage performer Chandrani Gunawardena has passed away at the age of 82.

title: Huge scam in driving licence printing: Minister
byline: A huge scam has been uncovered in the printing of driving licences by a single private company for more than two decades, Minister of Transport Bimal Ratnayake told Parliament today.

title: Controversial letter on LGBTQ tourism issued without consulting political authority: PM
byline: In the wake of the controversy over promoting LGBTQ tourism in Sri Lanka, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said today the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) Chairman had issued a letter with regard to LGBTQ tourism without consulting the political authority.

title: CIABOC unveils digital case-file tracking system
byline: In a landmark move to strengthen integrity, transparency, and accountability in governance, the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has launched a digital Case-File Tracking System to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of handling bribery and corruption cases in Sri Lanka.

title: Gold surges past $4,000 an ounce as uncertainty fuels rally
byline: The price of gold has hit a record high of more than $4,000 (£2,985) an ounce as investors look for safe places to put their money over concerns about economic and political uncertainty around the world.

title: At least 24 killed as paraglider drops bombs at Myanmar Buddhist festival
byline: A paramotor attack on a festival and protest in central Myanmar has killed at least 24 people and wounded 47 others, a spokesperson from the exiled National Unity Government told BBC Burmese.

title: AIIB provides USD 52 Mn to strengthen Sri Lanka’s power grid
byline: The Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) has signed a loan agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka to support the Kerawalapitiya–Port L Second Transmission Line Project, under which it will provide USD 52 million in sovereign-backed financing. The funding aims to enhance Sri Lanka’s power transmission capacity and unlock the country’s renewable energy potential, contributing to sustainable development.

title: Opposition raises concerns over recent police transfers
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today registered his strong protest in Parliament claiming that the government has transferred the powers of the Police Commission over police transfers to the Inspector General of Police (IGP).

title: Bombay High Court bars Shilpa Shetty from travelling to Sri Lanka
byline: Bollywood actor Shilpa Shetty has once again been stopped from leaving the country. The Bombay High Court on Wednesday refused her request to travel to Colombo, Sri Lanka, for a YouTube event scheduled between October 25 and 29, citing pending fraud allegations worth Rs 60 crore.

title: Wildlife Office to be established at Mattala Airport
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the establishment of a dedicated Wildlife Department office at Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport in Hambantota.

title: Denmark to ban social media for under-15s to protect children from ’unleashed monster’
byline: Denmark will ban social media for children under 15, Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen announced, accusing digital platforms of “stealing our children’s childhood.”

title: Cabinet approves Rs. 3 Bn airfield facility at Rathmalana Airport
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the construction of a new airfield facility complex at the Colombo International Airport in Rathmalana.

title: BIA records 14% rise in flight traffic in first eight months
byline: Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) has recorded a 14.4 percent increase in flight traffic during the first eight months of 2025 compared to the same period in 2024.

title: Namal accuses government of not taking vote on resolution adopted at UNHRC
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa today accused the government of not taking a vote for the resolution adopted without a vote at the 60th session of the United Nations Human Rights Council.

title: Ministry additional secretary arrested over alleged corruption
byline: Saman Kumari, former Acting Director General of the Office for Reparations and current Additional Secretary to the Ministry of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, was arrested today by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: MP Ravi Karunanayake raises Daily Mirror article in Parliament
byline: MP Ravi Karunanayake today raised the Daily Mirror article titled “Threat of power cuts looms?” in Parliament, describing it as a national issue and urging the Power and Energy Minister to respond.

title: Ronaldo becomes first football billionaire with big Saudi contract
byline: Cristiano Ronaldo’s football career has been a series of glittering firsts, from a record transfer to Real Madrid to scoring more competition goals than any man in history. He’s now notched up another huge win off the pitch: becoming the first billionaire player.

title: Move to ban planes flying over Parliamentary complex: Marikkar reveals
byline: While revealing that there is a move to ban planes flying over the Parliamentary complex, Opposition MP S.M. Marikkar today urged the government to change this decision.

title: Supreme Court to hear Shani’s FR petitions over arrest in 2021
byline: The Supreme Court today granted leave to proceed with three Fundamental Rights petitions filed challenging the arrest of former Director of the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) Shani Abeysekara and two other former CID officers in 2021.

title: CSE pulls back after three weeks of bullish momentum
byline: After three consecutive weeks of bullish performance, the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) witnessed a pullback, as investors opted to book profits following the recent market rally. The ASPI declined by 65.24 points (-0.29%) to close at 22,097.99, while the S&P SL20 fell 28.32 points (-0.46%) to 6,163.22, with a turnover of LKR 7.32 Bn.

title: ’’Looking forward to participating in NDTV world summit’’:  PM Harini
byline: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya will take part in the NDTV World Summit when she arrives in India next week. This will be the 55-year-old South Asian leader’s first official visit to the country.

title: Monk begins hunger strike in Tangalle over MR’s security
byline: Theripahala Siridhamma Thera of Rathupaswala commenced a hunger strike in Tangalle this afternoon (08) to protest the government’s decision to withdraw the security detail of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: Long-distance bus quality test begins tomorrow
byline: A pilot project to assess the quality of buses operating on routes exceeding 100 kilometers from the Bastion Road Passenger Bus Terminal is scheduled to commence tomorrow (09) morning.

title: Pavithra Fernando elected new President of Sri Lanka Rugby
byline: Former Sri Lanka and Ceylonese Rugby & Football Club (CR & FC) captain Pavithra Fernando has been elected as the new President of Sri Lanka Rugby (SLR).

title: Govt launches new results-based framework for ministries
byline: The government has rolled out a new Ministerial Results Framework for 22 line ministries and affiliated institutions to strengthen results-based management in the public sector over the period 2025–2029.

title: India finds serious testing lapses at pharma firms after cough syrup deaths
byline: A state health official sticks a notice outside the Sresan Pharmaceutical factory whose Coldrif cough syrup has been linked to the deaths of 17 children in Madhya Pradesh, in Chennai, India, October 7, 2025.

title: Former Reparations DG Sepalika Saman Kumari granted bail
byline: Sepalika Saman Kumari, former Director General of the Office for Reparations and current Additional Secretary to the Ministry of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, was released on bail today.

title: How has Sri Lanka destroyed Matheesha Pathirana?
byline: Having played in the most competitive franchise cricket league in the world - the Indian Premier League (IPL) even before his debut for Sri Lanka national team, Matheesha Pathirana was primed to be the next big thing in Sri Lankan pace bowling history, but fast forward two years he finds himself in a situation where he’d be incredibly lucky to be included in the squad for TWO World Cup.

title: Sri Lankan Swimmer Akalanka Among Australia’s Best
byline: Akalanka Peiris, a Sri Lankan domiciled down under triumphed at the Australian National Short Course Swimming Championships 2025 and is likely to be the next big story of swimming in the island. In the process Peiris broke the Sri Lankan national record in the 100m Individual Medley with a time of 55.89 seconds, surpassing the previous record of 56.49 seconds.

title: Mooney ton rescues Australia in stunning World Cup win over Pakistan
byline: A superb century from Beth Mooney dragged defending champions Australia back from the brink of disaster before they completed a crushing 107-run win over Pakistan in a Women’s World Cup clash in Colombo on Wednesday.

title: Energy Minister silent over Daily Mirror report
byline: Energy Minister Eng. Kumara Jayakody did not respond to the question raised in Parliament by MP Ravi Karunanayake under the headline “Threat of power cuts looms?” published in today’s Daily Mirror.

title: Bangladesh clubs to boycott matches over cricket board election
byline: A group of leading cricket clubs announced Wednesday a boycott of all domestic competitions, alleging widespread irregularities and government interference during the recent election of the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB).

title: Rugby and Cricket Blacklisted
byline: In what may be another alltalk and no action or more talk and less action scenario, Deputy Sports Minister Sugath Tillekaratne revealed that 67 toplevel sportsmen and women from 11 sports have been involved in using banned performance-enhancing substances.

title: Germany to allow police to shoot down drones
byline: Germany will grant police the power to shoot down rogue drones like those that have disrupted airports across Europe and that some European leaders have attributed to a hybrid war being waged by Russia.

title: Bribery Commission acted on political influence: Defence alleges
byline: Sepalika Saman Kumari, former Director General of the Office for Reparations and current Additional Secretary to the Ministry of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, was released on bail.
